intro: Terebinthus bipinnata, commonly known as the double-feather terebinth, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves with two sets of pinnae, giving it a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in panicles. Its fruit is a smooth, spherical drupe that contains a single seed. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it is often found in moist, shaded environments.
